item.title: 8 Horror Games With The Best Safe Modes, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • These horror games offer unique, non-threatening experiences focusing on atmosphere, environment, and exploration, aside from traditional life-threatening enemies.
  • Games like Layers of Fear, SOMA, and Year Walk provide chilling narratives and eerie settings without the risk of character death.
  • Phasmophobia and Amnesia: Rebirth offer customizable gameplay, allowing players to adjust difficulty for intense challenges or relaxed exploration.

For those who prefer their scares without the constant threat, easy or adventure modes offer a more lighthearted jaunt through, quite often, heavily story-driven settings. In horror games, the central mechanic often involves escaping or fighting off a dangerous entity. From ghosts and zombies to creatively horrifying monsters like those in Five Nights at Freddy's or Poppy Playtime , these threats heighten tension by putting the player’s survival on the line or making resources scarce.

However, not all horror games rely on this formula. Many titles manage to create intense fear without life-threatening enemies, offering players haunting experiences that focus on exploration and atmosphere and the minimal chance of death.

8 Layers Of Fear

A Picture Of Horror

In Layers of Fear , players take on the role of an unstable painter attempting to complete his magnum opus. As players navigate the painter’s eerily shifting mansion, they unravel his dark secrets and uncover the horrors that haunt his psyche.

The game features a wealth of jumpscares, but no enemies actively pursue the player in the original game (although there are two small sections in the remake). Instead, the haunted environment itself keeps players on edge. With its combination of psychological terror and a hauntingly beautiful art style, Layers of Fear stands out as a chilling exploration of a fractured mind.

7 SOMA

Its Safer Under The Sea

SOMA is a survival horror classic that challenges players with a deep, existential narrative and terrifying encounters. However, the 2017 “Safe Mode” update introduced a version of the game without enemies, allowing players to fully immerse themselves in its thought-provoking story. Unlike mods that make monsters harmless, Safe Mode alters their behavior to create a unique, non-threatening experience.

This mode emphasizes the game’s unsettling environment and philosophical questions, maintaining the core horror elements while eliminating the need to fight or flee.

6 Year Walk

Scarier Than An IKEA

Year Walk offers a short but unforgettable journey steeped in Swedish folklore. In this hour-long adventure game, players embark on a mysterious “Year Walk,” a traditional ritual said to grant visions of the future. As players wander through a dark forest, they encounter eerie supernatural beings and solve puzzles to progress.

Though the game is devoid of enemies, its haunting atmosphere and chilling lore create an unsettling experience that sticks with you for a long time.

5 Phasmophobia

The Friendly Ghost

Phasmophobia brings cooperative ghost-hunting to the forefront, with players investigating haunted locations and gathering evidence of paranormal activity. The game’s custom difficulty settings allow players to tweak their experience, including the ability to disable ghost hunts entirely by setting the ghost to "friendly." This mode can reduce the activity, make the ghosts slower — or even remove them entirely!

These settings make Phasmophobia a versatile horror game, offering both intense challenges and more relaxed exploration for those new to the genre. Whether playing solo or with friends, the game offers endless replayability and chills without necessarily putting the player's character in mortal danger.

4 Amnesia: Rebirth

Forget About It Being Scary

While Amnesia: Rebirth typically features terrifying creatures hunting the player, its Adventure Mode removes these threats, transforming the game into a puzzle-based exploration experience. The unsettling atmosphere remains intact, but without the fear of death, players can focus on uncovering the game’s narrative and solving environmental challenges.

This mode highlights the game’s rich storytelling and immersive world while making it accessible to those who shy away from traditional survival horror mechanics.

3 Alien: Isolation

Sci-Fi Terror With Training Wheel

What is this doing here? Widely regarded as one of the best sci-fi horror games, Alien: Isolation captures the essence of the Alien film franchise with its intense atmosphere and unpredictable Xenomorph encounters. While the game doesn't feature a true Safe Mode, the Isolation 's Novice Mode tones down the Alien's intelligence and aggression, offering players a less punishing experience.

With resources more plentiful and enemies easier to evade, Novice Mode allows players to explore the game’s intricately designed environments while still feeling the weight of its terrifying ambiance.

2 Summer Of '58

Not As Good As The Summer Of '69

  • Release : July 21, 2021
  • Platform(s) : PC
  • Developer(s) : EMIKA_GAMES

Set in an abandoned Soviet summer camp, Summer of '58 immerses players in a chilling story of restless spirits. Players assume the role of a blogger investigating paranormal phenomena at the site of a tragic incident.

The game focuses on exploration and uncovering the camp's dark history — without introducing any physical threats. Its eerie setting and psychological tension make it a great choice for fans of slow-burn horror.

1 The Vanishing Of Ethan Carter

Exploring The Mystery

Although The Vanishing of Ethan Carter isn’t a traditional horror game, its unsettling atmosphere and haunting story elements deliver a chilling experience. Players take on the role of a detective unraveling the mystery of Ethan Carter’s disappearance by exploring a beautifully desolate world and piecing together clues.

With no threats to the player’s safety, the game allows for immersive exploration, making it a compelling option for those seeking a lighter yet eerie adventure.

item.title: 6 Things That Could Appear In Rocksteady's Next Batman Game
item.description:
Summary

  • Court Of Owls: The sinister group from the comics may appear in the next Batman game, posing a significant threat to Gotham.
  • Terry McGinnis: Rocksteady might focus on Batman Beyond, introducing Terry as a futuristic Batman with new villains and characters.
  • Justice League: The return of Bruce Wayne could involve the League, providing an interesting storyline for his revival.

After the disappointing launch of Suicide Squad: Kill The Justice League , which became the late Kevin Conroy's final appearance as Batman, developer Rocksteady has gone back to the drawing board. If rumors are to be believed, Rocksteady is already working on a new Batman game, presumably either a continuation of the events post- Arkham Knight or some sort of reboot.

Over the course of a trilogy designed by Rocksteady and a spin-off by WB Montreal, they explored a huge portion of the Batman universe. But even after all those hours logged, there are still some parts of his world and the larger DC Comics universe that could be adapted. Whether it's characters that never made their way into the previous games or an entire storyline that could be adapted, these are just a few of the elements Rocksteady could pull from to guide their next Batman adventure.

6 Bruce Wayne

The Original Batman Could Return For Another Adventure

While it seems strange to assume Bruce Wayne may not be in a game about Batman, it's possible considering that he perishes at the end of 2014's Arkham Knight . But, as the comics and movies have shown us, Bruce Wayne is nigh-indestructible. Nearly every piece of Batman media has positioned him as a strong legacy character, as the likes of Dick Grayson and Damian Wayne have donned the cowl.

But, it would be hard to imagine Rocksteady not including the billionaire playboy, and considering how much time could potentially pass in the universe, it could lead either to some sort of adaptation of Frank Miller's The Dark Knight Returns , or a full-on reboot. A reboot may not be a bad idea, as it could reset the stage, bring Bruce back as a younger man with a new voice and allow a fresh start.

5 The Court Of Owls

Popular Villain Group From The Comics Could Debut In The Arkham Universe

This sinister organization first appeared in the comics in 2012, created by writer Scott Snyder and artist Greg Capulo. Made up of Gotham City's wealthiest elites, the Court came into conflict with Batman in a massively popular story arc. Since then, media adaptations of them have been sparse, although they did appear in WB Games Montréal's Gotham Knights (no relation to Rocksteady's Arkham universe). In the mainline Arkham games, the Court is non-existent, so now may be the time.

In their comic book appearances, the Court of Owls is seen as an urban myth, not unlike Batman himself. With Batman presumed dead by the end of Arkham Knight , the Court could make their move to further cement their grip on Gotham. And, if anything could bring a potentially alive Bruce Wayne out of retirement, it would be the Court, as this hugely popular villain group would make an excellent antagonist for players to face off against.

4 Terry McGinnis

Batman Of The Future Could Star In New Entry

It's entirely possible that Rocksteady will opt to keep their Batman on ice, instead focusing on something fans have been begging for by bringing in Terry McGinnis. First appearing in the popular 1990s animated series Batman Beyond , Terry McGinnis protects a futuristic version of Gotham City with an elder Bruce Wayne as his mentor, going up against all sorts of nasty new villains — and even a few from the past.

Adapting Terry McGinnis does mean Rocksteady has to find a way to resurrect Bruce Wayne, but that's easy enough in a universe with time-traveling speedsters and aliens with super-strength. But, the prospect of a Batman Beyond game remains one of the most exciting ideas, as flying around an advanced, futuristic vision of Gotham would be incredible. It opens up a whole new roster of villains and supporting characters, which is something that would make any potential Batman Beyond game stand out.

3 The Justice League

The Superfriends Could Unite To Find Batman

Despite numerous references and hints, the Justice League would not appear in full in the Arkham franchise until Suicide Squad: Kill The Justice League . And, if Rocksteady is determined to bring Bruce Wayne back, the Justice League could be the way forward.

Bruce's super friends would most assuredly want to find a way to bring their old pal back, and with their combined efforts, the idea of a game focusing on the League trying to find him could be outstanding. Perhaps even pull a bit from The Flashpoint Paradox , having The Flash travel through time looking for his old friend. Either way, it's quite possible, considering how well-received the League was in Suicide Squad , that Rocksteady may look at a way to bring them back.

2 The Mutants

Post-Apocalytpic Gang From The Dark Knight Returns Could Make Their Debut

If one assumes that Rocksteady will continue where Arkham Knight left off, entering a world where Batman is presumed dead could be a bit of fun. To that end, a Gotham under siege and without a protector would lead to all sorts of new baddies emerging. And, with The Mutants, the punk-style gang from The Dark Knight Returns , now could be their time to shine.

Led by the nefarious Mutant Leader, this gang consists of some of Gotham's most unhinged citizens. Their horrific crimes and presence as one of Gotham's most prominent gangs in The Dark Knight Returns makes them a perfect fit for any potential post- Arkham Knight game. Their presence could be as large or small as Rocksteady desires, either as primary antagonists or a secondary group, making Batman's return tougher than he anticipated.

1 Damian Wayne

The Son Of Batman Could Take Up The Mantle

  • Son of Batman (animated movie)
  • Release Date : April 22, 2014
  • Runtime : 74 minutes

Several years ago, concept art emerged for a canceled game at WB Montreal that would have starred Damian Wayne, the son of Bruce Wayne and Talia al Ghul. Known as Project Sabbath, it was to feature Damian as an older, grizzled Dark Knight in a post-apocalyptic version of Gotham that resembled the world of Batman Beyond in many ways. Indeed, Damian's suit resembled the futuristic outfit worn by Terry McGinnis, while new, updated versions of classic villains were also seen.

It's possible that WB Montreal was inspired by a comic book known as Batman 666, where Damian assumed the mantle in a dark, twisted future. Whatever their influence was, it could be a fabulous concept to dust off for the next Arkham game. It wouldn't require Bruce Wayne, so there's no need for a resurrection story. Seeing a sinister, apocalyptic Gotham come to life with Damian as the star would be incredible, and putting players in control of a far more aggressive, meaner Batman could be a ton of fun.

item.title: Minecraft: 19 Best Gameplay Challenges For Veteran Players
item.description:
Summary

  • Minecraft offers endless creativity through mods, enticing veteran players with new challenges and experiences.
  • Challenges like the Galacticraft Playthrough and Speedrun add depth to gameplay for seasoned players.
  • New mods like Scape and Run: Parasites and Hermit Chunk Challenge offer unique and tougher challenges.

Minecraft offers players no end to their creativity with constant updates and mods that allow almost anything to happen. It features a survival mode many players adore, but it's the creative aspect that draws most into the game. Many have reconstructed epic scenes and locations from various other games and movies with great precision and detail.

When a player becomes a veteran at Minecraft , they may feel like there's nothing left to do until the next update comes out. However, plenty of challenges make this game exciting for even the most long-term player. These challenges offer a new experience that can put a whole new outlook on the game.

Updated on December 13, 2024, by Gregory Louis Gomez: Minecraft is one of those games that simply has an ungodly lifespan. If players aren't just playing the game as it was intended for years on end, they're going out of their way to modify it in new and creative ways to elicit a fresh experience. Veteran players in particular are constantly on the lookout for ways to spice up their gameplay, such as modded worlds, popular tasks and goals, and more. With all of this in mind, we've decided to add a few more entries to the ever-expanding list of challenges for longtime Minecraft players.

19 Galacticraft Playthrough

Start a Space Race of Your Very Own in Minecraft

  • Difficulty: Easy - Hard

Minecraft allows players to do many things; climb the tallest mountains, explore the deepest oceans, and even travel between dimensions. The only thing it doesn't do is let you build a rocket and go to space, though that is where the Galacticraft mod comes in. This mod adds a ton of new resources and craftable tools and machines that can take you to the moon and beyond, where you will find new structures, loot, and mobs unlike anything else in the base game. Galacticraft is great because not only is it comprehensive in and of itself, but it can be paired with a wide array of mods that can make this challenge easier or harder depending on what the player is looking for.

18 Speedrun Challenge

Beat the Game as Fast as You Possibly Can

  • Difficulty: Easy - Hard

One of the more popular challenges Minecraft players have gotten into recently is to beat the game as quickly as humanly possible. All this means is getting to the End and killing the Ender Dragon, though doing this as quickly as possible can be deceptively challenging.

The level of challenge may fluctuate based on how fast the player wants to beat the game, meaning the better the time the harder it can be. This requires an intimate knowledge of both the game's basic mechanics, as well as knowledge of exploits, in order to save time and maximize efficiency of play.

17 Zombie Apocalypse

Try to Survive Against the Horde of the Undead

  • Difficulty: Hard - Severe

Minecraft has its standard zombies, but they aren't the biggest threat that the game has to offer, generally speaking. With mods, however, players can turn Minecraft into a true zombie survival game and ratchet the difficulty up immensely. Whether it's just turning up the number of zombies to overhauling their looks and behavior to make them more terrifying, the zombie apocalypse challenge offers players a much more stressful way to play the game than they may be used to.

As there's no single zombie apocalypse mod, players are encouraged to tailor their experience to their liking. They can find mod packs dedicated to zombie survival or just make one themselves. To facilitate their ideal apocalyptic experience.

16 Scape and Run: Parasites

You Will Not Survive

  • Difficulty: Hard - Severe

One of the most horrific mods one can download for Minecraft is Scape and Run: Parasites. This mod adds a whole new family of enemies to the game that not only infects a wide variety of other mobs, but the landscape itself. The parasite threat also continuously evolves over time, increasing in numbers, lethality, and complexity.

Put simply, the longer one plays this mod, the harder it becomes to survive each day, making it perfect for a long-term survival world. This mod is currently only available for Minecraft version 1.12.2 but is continuously updated with new features.

15 Herobrine Challenge

Go Toe to Toe With Minecraft's Deadliest Enemy (Sort of)

  • Difficulty: Moderate - Hard

While it's true that Herobrine has never officially been in Minecraft (despite every update saying it "removed him"), he has always been a fan favorite due to the lore surrounding him and the creepypasta in which he originated. Mods have allowed players to add him to their game in many different ways, any one of which would make for an interesting challenge for veteran players looking to spice up their gameplay experience.

Some of these mods can result in some serious scares, though that's certainly part of the fun for many. A great example is the Legend of Herobrine Mod, which adds a whole host of spooky additions and changes to the game along with the titular cryptid himself.

14 Survival Island Challenge

Survive the Full Duration of the Playthrough on a Single Island

  • Difficulty: Moderate

In this challenge, players will begin their game on an isolated island. Their entire playthrough is isolated to this one patch of land they cannot expand or leave, making it more difficult than regular survival mode. All resources will need to be obtained on this island.

Additionally, players will need to find a way to the Nether and the End without leaving said island. The goal is still to beat the Ender Dragon, which is entirely possible if they use the right strategy, though likely a reasonably difficult one and highly dependent on what seed the player is using for their map.

13 Nuclear Apocalypse Survival

Brave the Irradiated Ruins of the Overworld

  • Difficulty: Moderate

For all the Fallout or STALKER fans out there, this challenge is for you. There are many mods that can transform Minecraft into a nuclear hellscape, with all sorts of environmental hazards and mutated beasts to experience. There are plenty of mods and mod packs that would allow one to achieve this, many of which have been mentioned on this list, but generally, you'd need mods that add things like radiation, mutants, and either a custom-themed map or something like the Lost Cities mod, which can add explorable ruins to the overworld.

12 Hermit Chunk Challenge

How Fast Can You Defeat the Ender Dragon When Everything is Provided?

  • Difficulty: Hard

The Hermit Chunk Challenge requires players to download and use a mod that allows them to start the challenge. The mod spawns players on a 16x16 chunk of land that, surprisingly enough, has everything they need for survival. It includes a cave, lava, rare ores, and wood.

Despite its small size, players can still access the Nether and the End. The game's ultimate goal is still the same: to defeat the Ender Dragon. Players must be quick-witted and think on their toes to survive using this mod.

11 Nomad Challenge

Live the Rough Life of a Hunter Gatherer in Minecraft

  • Difficulty: Moderate

As the name implies, players must constantly be on the move in the Nomad Challenge. They are not allowed to create a home base where they return night after night to rest. Spending the night in a hut is permitted, but only if they destroy it in the morning when they wake up.

Additionally, using chests is forbidden in this challenge. A nomad would not have a storage chest as they would only take what they can carry, so players must plan accordingly to determine what they will take with them. They have 27 storage slots, nine hotbar slots, four armor slots, and one off-hand slot where they can place things, totaling 41 slots. While this may seem decent, it can fill up pretty quickly, leaving players in a bind.

10 Skyblock Challenge

Make the Most Out of Very Little to Complete This Minecraft Challenge

  • Difficulty: Moderate

The Skyblock Challenge requires a mod and is one of the classic Minecraft challenges. Players will be spawned on a small patch of earth floating in the sky. It has a tree and a chest with survival items. There's nothing, and really no room for anything else.

The goal is to build outward until players find other Skyblock Islands. Mistakes are commonly made, requiring restarting the game. The simplest mistake can result in having to go back to square one. After they've built out sufficiently, they'll be able to challenge the Ender Dragon. When the boss is successfully defeated, the challenge is complete.

9 Hardcore Mode

Put Everything on the Line for this Minecraft Challenge

  • Difficulty: Hard

For those who have already been through everything the game has to offer, they can take things up a notch with Hardcore Mode. However, this setting can be very frustrating because players can put a lot of work into their world only to lose everything permanently when they die. That's right. Death is permanent, and the world is erased .

As players may suspect, the difficulty level is set to Hard and cannot be changed. They should have all the information about this setting before turning it on to avoid upsets while playing. It's definitely not something for beginners to try to tackle.

8 City Construction Challenge

Build a Bustling City in Your Minecraft World

  • Difficulty: Easy

Players who want to sit back and take their time moving through the game will enjoy the City Construction Challenge. The goal of this challenge is for players to find a village and befriend all who live there. Then, they'll need to help build the town into a city with all the features a city has, including a protective wall and grander buildings.

This challenge will take quite a while to complete. When the city is fully grown and thriving, the challenge is complete. Building trust and relationships with the villagers will take significant time and dedication.

7 Pacifism Challenge

Violence of any Kind is Strictly Off the Table

  • Difficulty: Hard

This is a challenge that may be perfect for players with kind hearts. There is no attacking anyone or anything of any kind throughout the playthrough. This includes hostile mobs and animals for food. So when players are being attacked, they'll have to find ways to quickly escape danger without harming their foes.

Planting crops will be their primary source of food. Hunting is not an option, as injuring cows and similar animals is forbidden to complete the challenge successfully.

6 OneBlock Survival Challenge

How Far Can You Get With Only One Block?

  • Difficulty: Severe

The OneBlock Survival mod can be downloaded on the Minecraft marketplace for free. Though it spawns players on a single block, however, this one block can be mined repeatedly. Over time, the mined materials increase in value, and from it, they can create an entire world to play around in.

They'll have to continuously mine and build, but eventually, they'll have their own made-from-scratch creation. There are other patches of the world to find as well, where the player may interact with NPCs and slay enemies.

5 Mod Pack Challenge

Download a Random Mod Pack and See What Happens

  • Difficulty: Variable

Minecraft is one of the most moddable games around, and by extension, is one of the most modded by players. There are countless websites dedicated to hosting mods for the game that do all sorts of things. One of the things players like to do, however, is to compile a bunch of mods and upload them as a single package.

Each mod works together in order to create a new experience, which could be anything from a survival horror overhaul to a recreation of Portal . To check out some of these mod packs, head over to curseforge.com.

4 Single Biome Challenge

Survive the Whole Playthrough in Just One Biome

  • Difficulty: Moderate

Players can provide themselves with a challenge by changing their world to one biome and attempting to survive. They can make it even more difficult by making it a barren biome that is difficult to survive in, like a desert or badlands biome.

When creating a new world, they'll need to change the setting under "More Options" to "Single Biome." This will allow them to choose which biome they want the game to generate.

3 Role Play Challenge

Experience Minecraft as a Specific Type of Character

  • Difficulty: Easy

Given that Minecraft features a completely black slate character for the player to inhabit, role-playing is extremely easy to do, though it is a bit limited without the aid of some mods. With mods, however, players can play the game in certain specialized ways that they normally wouldn't, such as a mage, a warrior, or maybe just a simple farmer.

One could even download a skin of their favorite characters from other games and role-play as one of them in a themed world to match. Imagine recreating the world of The Last of Us and playing as Joel, or playing a character within Middle-earth for example.

2 Sky Factory Challenge

Building a Whole New World From the Ground Up

  • Difficulty: Hard

Sky Factory is a massive mod pack for Minecraft that adds a ton of new things to create that can turn the game world upside down and inside out. Though it spawns the player on a single tree floating in empty space, this tree provides everything the player will need to slowly but surely expand and create a whole ecosystem of their own.

After a while, it will seem as if the player has amassed so much power that they may even inadvertently destroy their world with it if they aren't careful. Sky Factory can be downloaded for free on curseforge.com.

1 100 Days Challenge

Can You Beat the Game in 100 Days Without Dying?

  • Difficulty: Severe

This challenge allows players to take Hardcore Mode up a notch. They'll need to beat the Ender Dragon while playing Hardcore Mode in 100 in-game days or less. This ramps up the difficulty, turning the game almost into a speed run. Time-counter mods can be installed to assist with counting the days.

Players should be warned that it's not advisable to engage the Ender Dragon too early, as death is permanent. Waiting until the last minute will allow for the most preparation.

item.title: Black Ops 6 Dev Comments on Whether Omnimovement Could Be in Future Call of Duty Games
item.description:
Summary

  • The new omnimovement mechanic in Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is now largely enjoyed by players despite being divisive at launch.
  • Treyarch's Associate Creative Director believes in the long-term potential of omnimovement in the Black Ops series.
  • Future Call of Duty titles, especially those by Treyarch, are likely to keep omnimovement and introduce new innovative features like the Body Shield move.

The development team for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 has recently commented on what the future holds for its newly-implemented omnimovement mobility mechanic. The new movement system—which allows players to execute movements like sprinting, sliding, and diving in any direction—seems to now be largely enjoyed by players after being considered divisive at launch. With players having had the time to get used to the new type of movement, many are wondering if the feature will remain in installments after Call of Duty: Black Ops 6.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 launched on October 25, making it the 21st overall installment of the long-running shooter series. While many of the hallmarks that define the Call of Duty series' gameplay experience remain largely intact, the introduction of omnimovement has marked a significant change in how players approach combat. Associate Director of Design Matt Scronce recently elaborated on the reasoning behind Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's movement decisions, with another Associate Director chiming in on whether those decisions are here to stay.

In a recent interview with Dexerto, Treyarch's Associate Creative Director Miles Leslie spoke about the new movement system, and if it will be a staple for the series going forward. While a definitive answer wasn't given, Leslie has had faith in the use of omnimovement since the conceptual phase, as the development team has "truly believed in its potential," at least with Treyarch and the Black Ops series it's always developed. Explaining how "inspiring" it's been to see players make high-level plays utilizing the mechanic, Leslie went on to state that "we haven't seen the limits of its potential yet."

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Has More Than Just Omnimovement

Based on the interview, it seems more likely than not that future Call of Duty titles will keep omnimovement, or at least ones that Treyarch has a hand in developing, considering the series tends to rotate developers for its annual releases. However, it isn't the only new feature that's been introduced to players. Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 introduces the Body Shield move, which allows players to take an enemy as a hostage, utilizing them as a human shield while still able to fire. While arguably less impactful than omnimovement, the tactical move demonstrates the franchise's ability to innovate.

In addition to discussing the potential permanence of omnimovement, Miles Leslie also spoke about bringing back old content, with the Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 dev teasing more classic map remasters. Already bringing back Hacienda from Black Ops 4, more classic maps are poised to return, with Leslie giving the promising statement that "no previous Black Ops title is off the table" for being considered for a remaster. However, they did say the studio is focused on creating "original designs" for most of Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 's post-launch maps.

Gamers who have yet to try out the latest Call of Duty and all of its new features can do so risk-free for a limited time, as there is currently a free trial for Call of Duty: Black Ops 6, allowing players to access the game's Multiplayer and Zombies modes.

item.title: Infinity Nikki: Where to Find Aromalily
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Where to Find Aromalily in Infinity Nikki
  • Where to Purchase Aromalily in Infinity Nikki

There are many materials that players can obtain in Infinity Nikki that can be used to create new outfits or individual clothing pieces. However, when you are in need of specific materials and can't find them anywhere, it can be difficult and frustrating, especially since the map is so big.

In particular, Aromalilies can be a tough find at first, but there are a few different spots where you can obtain the crafting item. If you are looking for a few easy locations to grab some Aromalilies in Infinity Nikki , here are the best spots to add the item to your inventory.

Where to Find Aromalily in Infinity Nikki

If you are currently searching for some Aromalilies, but can't track them in your collections since you haven't found one yet, there is one particular spot that is best for farming them quickly and easily without having to complete many main quests.

Florawish Shores

The easiest spot you can get some Aromalilies early on in the game is at the shores of Florawish. In particular, you can find some east of the Florawish Lane Warp Spire , shown in the map image above. Jump on the lily pads that are in the water here, and grab the purple flowers on the lily pads.

The Aromalily can only be obtained during the day . At night, the flower will be closed, and you won't be able to grab it.

Now that you've got about 4 Aromalilies in your inventory, you can now track the flower. Go to your map screen, and navigate to the bottom left, and click the middle button to go to your collections. On the first page, scroll down until you reach the Aromalily. From here, choose ' Track ', and you'll be able to find additional locations where Aromalilies are. For example, you can find some west of the location you are currently at in the water, where you can also do some fishing, as shown in the fourth image above.

Where to Purchase Aromalily in Infinity Nikki

If you aren't in the mood to do some searching for Aromalilies, luckily, you can also purchase the flower. However, this will require you to spend a Surging Ebb, which is a relatively difficult item to come by. Here's how to purchase an Aromalily:

  • Start by opening up your Pear-Pal.
  • Click the Store tab.
  • Navigate to the Resonance tab.
  • Scroll to the bottom to find the Aromalily, costing 1 Surging Ebb .

If you currently don't have any Surging Ebbs, they can be obtained from getting duplicates of a 5-star item when rolling in Resonance. If you are the type who prefers a free-to-play version of Infinity Nikki , however, we highly recommend saving your Surging Ebbs for other items, such as Revelation Crystals.
